channel.title: [PI] Dice command help?

item.title: [PI] Dice command help?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

55x2 doesnt require you to imply another username.

55x2 would be
[corpze] I wanna bet
[Vain] ::dice
[shouts] Vain rolled a 85 on dice. He loses!

it would be stupid to do
::dice corpze
[Vain] rolls 89
[shouts] corpze rolled a 89, Vain wins! (this doesnt have any usage of the other player, except for the yell message.

your concept is retarded. so either construct a secondary client object yourself (like you want to) or use the code above.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Dice command help?
item.dc:creator: @corpze corpze
item.description:
@corpze wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:8, topic:528236”]how the hell will you know if you’ve won against another player if they haven’t rolled?

your system is like saying:

[Vain] ::dice corpze
[Vain] rolls a 56
[corpze] never rolls
[shouts] Vain won against corpze!

if that’s how retarded you want your system, i am not helping you write it. i just spent my time writing the above code. take it and be happy, or learn to construct a new client object for the player2[/quote]

u ever heard of 55x2? rofl

item.title: [PI] Dice command help?
item.dc:creator: @corpze corpze
item.description:
@corpze wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:4, topic:528236”]public boolean hasRolled = false; public int myRoll;

[code=Java]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“dice”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
String other;

for (int i = 0; i < args.lenth(); i++) {
    other = args[i] + " ".trim(); 
}

for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
    if (p != null) {
        Client c = new (Client)p;
    }
    if (p.properName.equals(other)) {
        Client o = new (Client)other;
    }

    if (!c.hasRolled && !o.hasRolled)) {
        if (c.myRoll == null && o.hasRolled == null) {
            c.myRoll = Misc.random(99) + 1;
            c.hasRolled = true;
        }
    } else {
        if (c.hasRolled && !o.hasRolled)) {
            c.sendMessage("You've already rolled your dice! Wait for " + o.properName ".");
            o.sendMessage(c.properName + " has rolled their dice! Please roll yours.");
        }
        if (o.hasRolled && !c.hasRolled)) {
            o.sendMessage("You've already rolled your dice! Wait for " + c.properName ".");
            c.sendMessage(o.properName + " has rolled their dice! Please roll yours.");
        }
        if (c.hasRolled && o.hasRolled) {
            if (c.hasRolled && c.myRoll != null) {
                c.forcedChat("I've rolled a  " + c.myRoll + " and " + (c.myRoll > o.myRoll) ? "won" : "lost") + " against " + o.properName + ".");
                o.forcedChat("I've rolled a  " + o.myRoll + " and " + (o.myRoll > c.myRoll) ? "won" : "lost") + " against " + c.properName + ".");
                c.myRoll = null;
                c.hasRolled = null;
            }
        }
    }
}

}[/code]very confusing to write code in moparscape’s reply box. i may be missing some features or something. also, the way you may want to produce is sending a dice request. because i believe this way i just wrote may server some serious issues[/quote]
i the only thing i want is this : i do ::dice othername

[size=14pt]i shout: myname rolled 55 and won againts othername[/size]

i i dont want a request for dice i just want that part above:D

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Dice command help?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

public boolean hasRolled = false; public int myRoll;

[code=Java]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“dice”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
String other;

for (int i = 0; i < args.lenth(); i++) {
    other = args[i] + " ".trim(); 
}

for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
    if (p != null) {
        Client c = new (Client)p;
    }
    if (p.properName.equals(other)) {
        Client o = new (Client)other;
    }

    if (!c.hasRolled && !o.hasRolled)) {
        if (c.myRoll == null && o.hasRolled == null) {
            c.myRoll = Misc.random(99) + 1;
            c.hasRolled = true;
        }
    } else {
        if (c.hasRolled && !o.hasRolled)) {
            c.sendMessage("You've already rolled your dice! Wait for " + o.properName ".");
            o.sendMessage(c.properName + " has rolled their dice! Please roll yours.");
        }
        if (o.hasRolled && !c.hasRolled)) {
            o.sendMessage("You've already rolled your dice! Wait for " + c.properName ".");
            c.sendMessage(o.properName + " has rolled their dice! Please roll yours.");
        }
        if (c.hasRolled && o.hasRolled) {
            if (c.hasRolled && c.myRoll != null) {
                c.forcedChat("I've rolled a  " + c.myRoll + " and " + (c.myRoll > o.myRoll) ? "won" : "lost") + " against " + o.properName + ".");
                o.forcedChat("I've rolled a  " + o.myRoll + " and " + (o.myRoll > c.myRoll) ? "won" : "lost") + " against " + c.properName + ".");
                c.myRoll = null;
                c.hasRolled = null;
            }
        }
    }
}

}[/code]very confusing to write code in moparscape’s reply box. i may be missing some features or something. also, the way you may want to produce is sending a dice request. because i believe this way i just wrote may server some serious issues

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Dice command help?
item.dc:creator: @corpze corpze
item.description:
@corpze wrote:

hi, i got this command and im sure u know what i want it to do?, but i cant figure out how to make it do it:/

i want this command to work like this: i do ::dice “name”

if i win i will say : [“my name”] rolled “number” and won against “player 2’s name”
and the other way around if i lose
when i do the command it just does like this etc: [corpze] rolled 55 and won againts corpze…

how do i fix this?

if (playerCommand.startsWith("dice")) { int r = Misc.random(99) + 1; if (r >= 45){ c.forcedChat("@red@["+c.playerName+"] Rolled "+ r +" and WON against "+ c2.playerName +""); } else if (r <= 44){ c.forcedChat("@red@["+c.playerName+"] Rolled "+ r +" and lost to "+ c2.playerName +" "); } }

Read full topic
